Pre-Game Insights: Under Menzo, Suriname are playing with a lot more freedom, while his aggressive approach seems to have unlocked the potential of numerous players, and we believe their overall quality could be too much for an inexperienced Guyana side to handle.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Guyana are currently ranked 154th by FIFA
Suriname have not won an away match against Guyana since June 2008
Four of their six Nations League contests at the Synthetic Track and Field Facility have resulted in a victory for Guyana
Six Suriname players are available for this match who have yet to earn a senior cap
Gleofilo Vlijter will become the record goalscorer for the men's program with his next strike
Etienne Vaessen has started both matches between the sticks for them in World Cup qualifying in place of Warner Hahn
Suriname head into a new Nations League campaign in high spirits on the back of two convincing victories in World Cup qualifying
Guyana will face some of the more experienced sides that this region has to offer in 2024-25
Guyana will play in a group featuring Costa Rica, Guatemala, Martinique, Guadeloupe and Suriname
Suriname have yet to lose in three matches played across all competitions, outscoring their three opponents by a combined margin of 9-2
Suriname have only suffered one defeat in their previous seven matches played across all competitions
Others: Jamal Shabazz selected numerous players who feature domestically in Guyana
Elliot Bonds, Stephen Duke-McKenna and Liam Gordon, who all play in League Two with Cheltenham Town, Harrogate Town and Walsall respectively
Terence Vancooten plays in League One for Burton Albion
Six Suriname players are available for this match who have yet to earn a senior cap
Three players selected for this window currently feature in the EFL Championship
Suriname possible starting lineup: Vaessen; Dijksteel, Abena, Denswil, Haps; Lonwijk, Pherai, Paal, Misidjan; Vlijter, Becker
Guyana possible starting lineup: McKenzie-Lyle; Lovell, J. Jones, Vancooten, Gordon; Ferguson, Bonds, Moriah-Welsh, Duke-McKenna; Moore, I. Jones
